She called in a rx for Cipro. I was grateful she didn't ask me to go to the ER. I get my blood drawn today to check WBC. I'm sure it's low.... For being 9 days post 1st rx, I feel just yucky. I'm still letting my kids cut my hair short tomorrow. At this pint, I just don't care. :(. Hoping to feel better soon.

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2011 09:58PM Josie4 wrote: WaveWhisper... How is your hair? I'm on day 12 like you. I buzzed my long hair yesterday to a number two on the clippers. I bought a wig today but I don't foresee mmuself wearing it tooooooo often. It's itchy and I don't like hair in or near my face. Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2012 07:36PM Josie4 wrote: Hi everyone. I haven't posted for awhile because I've been living an almost normal life (besides going bald.). I have felt great, have been waking 2 miles/day and have been super busy with my kids. I haven't really thought toooo much about cancer! But like many of you expressed.... It was hard to sart chemo number 2 today because I know hat my good days are about to end. I'll be having he neulesta shot tomorrow for the first time. Im armed with Claritin! Quick question.... Has anybodys MO expressed concern about being around kids who were recently vaccinated? I photograph kids. I recently sacred booking sessions again.... Only one week out of the month when I know I'll be feeling well and WBC should be up. I'm always wiping kids noses and slobber and when photographing babies in the buff, I'll occasionally even get peed on! My MO did NOT want me to be in contact with any kids body fluid. Not because I could hurt them, but because they shed some of their vaccinations through their body fluid for several weeks after being vaccinated. Has anybody been warned about this? I will cancel all sessions if there is a serious risk to me. Any thoughts? It sounds like many of us are starting our second and third treatments his week. Yay us!!!!! It almost feels like I can see he end of this "ride" being possible. Take care, josie

One of the side effects of Cytoxin is sinus issues. My sinuses started burning during my treatment. They stopped the tx and did a saline flush. Maybe you cold ask for it next time? That's it for me... Just hoping this achiness goes away soon! Im taking Claritin, alive and I'm using lots of Icy Hot. Ug, I just hate this! Josie

Posts.Content: Dec 14, 2011 06:50PM - edited Dec 14, 2011 06:51PM by Josie4 Hello ladies... So happy to find a forum so specific to my protocol. I am 40 ( as of yesterday!). I had a BMX 4 weeks ago. The tissue expanders are so uncomfortable and I can't believe that I'm stuck with them till summertime! My Oncotype came back as a 25, so here I am..... I'll start TCx4 on Dec 19th. I'm scared about how I'll feel by Christmas. I have 11 year old triplets and I really need to feel good for them (...or at least try to fake it!). I'm trying to plan extended family portraits since I'd love to still have my own hair. I plan to cut my hair short and send it in to have an "underhair" made. You can check it out at www.hatswithhair.com. When did you all notice the texture of your hair changing or major shedding start? I look forward to getting to know you all... Josie

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2011 11:53AM - edited Dec 31, 2011 11:54AM by Josie4 Hi everyone... I'm on day 12. Yesterday was my best say yet since first treatment. I felt perfect! I did a lot of housecleaning, caught up on some work and went on a bike ride with my kids. I think I'll be feeling normal for a good 9 days until I have rx 2 and I'm so excited about it! WaveWhisper... It's good to hear you being feisty... It means that you are feeling better too :). I watched the movie "Living Proof" yesterday. It was about the man that developed Herceptin. While I'm not on Herceptin, it made me really have a deeper appreciation for the women who signed up for new trials. Some were taken off the drug even though it was WORKING for them, simply because they had to document/prove that the progress stopped when the drug was withdrawn. Anyways, I am so grateful for the women who made our treatments today possible. Ckk: my MO said that the WBC levels can drop as quickly as they rise. I'm glad your MO proactively put you on antibiotics. April: thanks for the recipes. I think we'd all love to have someone like you to cook for us and take care of us during chemo! Your mom is so lucky to have you. Have a wonderful weekend ladies! Josie

Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2012 02:02AM - edited Feb 5, 2012 02:04AM by Josie4 Hi ladies. I am so sorry that I have been MIA lately. Last week I was feeling so perfectly normal, I nearly forgot about chemo, BC, etc. I am just in awe at some of you who can remember the specifics on each other. Please know that even though I don't write words of encouragement to each of you, I have read every single post and I think of you all daily. I have learned so much from you all andi too am sooooo grateful for this group. For some reason, links don't show up on my iPad, but when I get on my computer, I'll figures out how to sign up on the Facebook page. I think I'm on the same schedule as Ckk, Wave and LeAnne. I had my 3rd chemo on Monday. Im now 5 days post tx. WOW... This was a much tougher one for me. My MO said that there would not be an culmative effect.." but she was sugar coating it.... On Day 2 I was slammed with major fatigue. I slept for 20 plus hours a day for 3 days. I had nausea for the first time too. I tried acupuncture for the first time (for bone pain) and I swear the pain wasnt nearly as bad as last time!!!! I'm going again on Monday and I will definitely go on my next round too. Amazing! I'm hoping to make it to three of my kids sports games today. Actually, I WILL be there... I'll just probably sleep all day tomorrow to recuperate from it. Is anyone else sensitive to NOISE? Everything is so magnified to me right now! Maybe I'll bring some ear plugs. Yes, Im getting rid of all non paraben free products. The link that someone provided has been great. I don't mean to become a fanatic, but .... I have. I also tossed all of my Teflon pans. Did you all know that drier sheets coat your cloths in carcinogens? All drier sheets are now in the trash. I also buy mostly organic food and plan to rip all the grass out of my yard to start my own garden (buying organic is expensive!). I am also off all refined sugars, milk and red meat. I am much healthier because of BC! I've lost 11 pounds since diagnosis. By default, my family will all be healthier too. Have a wonderful weekend everyone! Josie
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2012 06:04PM Josie4 wrote: Hi Ladies. good to hear everyone's updates.  Amazing that we are all getting so close to the end. You all know that I'm terrible rememebering who says what... but here are some random thoughts after reading everone's posts.... -yes, sleep patterns are crazy.  I wake up many times throughout the night.  I never did that before. -round 3, I had MAJOR fatigue.  That was my only se this time around.  I still take a 2 hour nap after my morning walk.  -I think that our husbands are tired of all this chemo stuff.  Mine isn't as attentive.  I had to laugh at whoever's husband wouldn't carry the dog crate because he was too tired.  I'm having the same issues in my household with my husband and kids.  They are forgetting what I am going through! -Periods.  I must have ovaries of steel!  I had a full period after chemo #1.  A very light period after chemo #2 and a medium period after #3.  I have not had any hot flashes.  Should I be concerned that chem isn't doing what it is supposed to? -My eyebrows and eyelashes are all intact.  I've heard they go after the last tx.. but mine are staying put so far.  I've been applying very little mascara.... trying to protect them.  We'll see......... So, I've been wondering about followup.  What kind of followup are you all getting?  Besides medication, are any of you getting frequent scans of any kind????  How do we KNOW that the chemo worked?????   I've been worried about that lately.  I want proof!  :) Have a good night, Josie
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2012 03:27PM Josie4 wrote: Congrats Kathy!  I hope these next two weeks are kind to you! Anniebell, thank you for the info on YMCA!  I will call them tomorrow. Wave, I'm 90 percent estrogen positive too.  One thing kind of bothers me...... my MO hasn't educated me about what to/no to eat.  It doesn't sound like anyone else's does either.  Everything I've read online says that sugar feeds cancer and how important it is not not eat sugar.  Isn't this something that we should be warned about from our MOs?  Sugar is a hard one for me, but I'm definitly laying off of it.  For those of you that are trying to eat more veggies are are into making smoothies, this is a wonderful site:  www.greensmoothiegirl.com  You can also search Green Smoothie Girl on www.youtube.com and you can see many of her demos. Ok.... have any of you concidered having your portrait taken as a bald woman?  I know this sounds crazy considering I won't even let my kids or husband see me bald, but I really wanted to do this.  I figured that I should have at least a few pictures of me being bald.... for the memory..... and I want them to be nice.  I want to at least feel beautiful.  SO...... I did it today!  I was kind of nervous because I felt naked!  I also felt a little silly, but I think they turned out kind of cool.  I'll share some on facebook when I get them.   Does anyone know if I share them on facebook on our private group.... will it show up so all of my friends can see?  I hope not.... most of my friends don't even know that I had breast cancer and am going through chemo..... I'd hate for them to find out by accidentally seeing my bald pics!  :) Goodnight all, Josie
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2012 09:21PM - edited Feb 22, 2012 09:24PM by Josie4 Hi everyone. I've been offline for a few days as I was getting ready for my LAST infusion. I was busy wrapping p obligations, doing laundry, getting the house in order. It was so nice to read back on all the posts to get caught up on all of you. It especially warmed my heart to read thy you all remembered my last chemo date and shared your well wishes with me. Thank you! Chemo went well. Appnt with MO went well. Wave, thank you for sharing your MOs recommendations. Mine said: -follow up appnts and labeork with her every 4 months -she will do breast checks. No breast tissue, so mammograms aren't worth being exposed to radiation. -annual MRis instead -I will start Tamoxifen next month. I will probably get my period back while on Tamoxifen. She warned me to use protection , as it would be bad to get pg. yeah it would!!!!! We are all so right on with the side effects. My thigh muscles have been so weak! I thought I wasthe only one! I went on a bike ride with my family on Saturday. I couldn't make it home! My legs gave up! My hubby had to ride ahead and pick me up. One day post last tx, I am nauseated and tired! It hit a little earlier than I expected. Oh well, I'm prepared. I had my last Neulasta shot today. I go in for acupuncture tomorrow morning. YES, I'm a believer! I will turn to acupuncture for any future aches and pains! I also JUST started experiencing these miserable hot flashes and they are just as you all describe it to be! I strip down totally naked and rip off my night cap several times a night and PRAY that my hubby doesn't wake up to see me (I still haven't let him see me bald or shirtless!). It's a good thing he's a deep sleeper.... Haha I've managed to keep most of my eyebrows... Please let them stay put! My lashes are thinning, but I still wear mascara. I just bought an elliptical machine. I'm still down 8 pounds, but I feel flabby. I'm feeling tired and useless right now, but it's exciting to see the light t the end of the tunnell. I will get back in shape so I feel better. My biggest passion is gardening! I've got 12 fruit trees that are starting to produce. I'm now taking out most of my grass to start my raised garden boxes to grow organic veggies. I need a little more strengh to start that project.. But I'm getting there! We did it/are doing it ladies! Josie
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane

Posts.Content: Dec 26, 2011 04:52PM Josie4 wrote: So.... Isn't the chemo supposed to prevent the period? I got my period today. Blah! Michelle, I was taking an occasional comparing for nausea, but it was just barely keeping it at bay. I switched to Zofran today and felt relief within 20 minutes. It's longer lasting relief too. My g'day is dec 12 th, we are exactly one month apart! Is anyone else experiencing ACNE? I haven't had a single pimple in over 20 years! How long will this last. I will really cry if I have to be bald and have acne!! Josie

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2011 03:41AM - edited Dec 27, 2011 03:51AM by Josie4 Hi everyone. Nice to hear updates. Heather... I think getting a dog is a great idea! We got a little lap dog right before I got BC. It's so wonderful to have a pet to stroke and hang out with you when you don't feel well! Jam pus, welcome. I had a bMX with tissue expanders on 11/17. Chemo started on 12/19. I barely felt well by then. The warm breasts would concern me. Make sure that you are really healing well before starting chemo. Food wise, I don't have cravings yet. I need to remember to eat smaller more frequent meals though. I seem to experience more nausea and heartburn when I eat a full meal. Originally I was going to cut my hair short a few days after Christmas but now I'm scared. My first treatment was 7 days ago. I want to cut my hair and send it in to www.hatswithhair.com to have a halo made with my own hair. I figured I should cut it before it starts to shed. My scalp is getting a little itchy.... Not sure if it's getting ready to shed. The hair thing is freaking me out! I'm trying to make it less of a big deal for my kids. I asked if they wanted to be the ones to cut my hair and they jumped at it! They want to give me a Mohawk and shave out heart shapes. They also want to color it. (They are 11 years old.) Is day 10 too premature for this? Will I be shedding by then?

Does anyone else have anything to recommend for m poor tongue? Wave... So sorry. Don't push yourself when you are so tired. Hopefully you'll be feeling some energy soon. Josie

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2012 02:42PM Josie4 wrote: I'm totally laughing about the "look how well you're doing" and "you're half way done" comments. I just want to scream because they make it sound so EASY! The other thing I hate is when people are talking about hats and wigs and they say, "have FUN with it,". Seriously.?! Fun!? Ok..... One more rant.... It is amazing how many people that I see when I'm out and about that turn the other way when they see me. These are people that I know! I wear a scarf and hat when I go out, so I know it's obvious that I'm going through chemo.." I'm sure people just don't know what to say, so they say nothing at all.... But it still hurts! Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2012 02:03PM - edited Jan 22, 2012 02:07PM by Josie4 Rachel... happy birthday! Do something nice for yourself. I hope everyone pampers you! Wave... Yes, we are on the same schedule. Are you a little scared of number 3? I am.... Hoping the culmative effect doesn't hit us hard. Lisa and Ckk, so glad you are happy with the old caps! Heatherb8.... I know what you mean about the need for help and that $40 was worth every penny to get something done that you physically couldn't do. However, I guarantee you that if the mother of the four boys knew that you were going through chemo, she'd be having those boys shovel your driveway more often as an act of service. I think you or your hubby should tell them what you are going through. Maybe hubby could just thank the mom that her son helped out and casually mention that he helped on a day that you were struggling from chemo side effects. I mention this so you don't have to shovel your driveway as often and most importantly to give that family the opportunity to help you out. Every kid needs the opportunity to serve. Since we are sharing our stories of how we were delivered "the news"..... I had gone to my OB for my annual checkup in Sept. He never felt anything.. I hadn't either. He told me to come back next year, when I turned 40, for a mammogram. The following month was breast cancer awareness month and a mammogram place was offering super cheap mammograms. I just decided to get one because it was such a good deal. Never in my wildest dreams did I think they'd ever find anything. The radiologist called me the following day as I was in the car with my 11 year old daughter. I pulled over and took the call outside of the car. I didn't tell a soul, not even my husband for a full day. I just couldn't believe it. Looking back, that was super unhealthy. I thought I had received a death sentence. That was only three months ago....... Seems like forever ago! We've all been through soooooooo much these last few months! Have a good Sunday! Josie

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2011 09:24AM - edited Dec 21, 2011 09:25AM by Josie4 Had my first TC infusion two days ago. The treatment was uneventful. It was odd to be the absolute youngest one there. I'm 40 and every other pt there ranged from age 60-80. Several were expressions their sadness to see such a "young one" among them. I had a headache that night and a mild one the next morning. I'm prone to headaches so I wasn't surprised. It was manageable. No weird pains or metallic taste. I haven't hit any fatigue yet but suspect that to come int the next day or so. I was worried about constipation but milk of magnesia took care of that in one dose. Momof3boys.... I plan to cut my hair super short a few days after Christmas (it's about 4 inches below my shoulder right now.). I just can't bare to let it fall out all over the house. I had a little "pow-wow" with my kids to re-explain things. Between the 3 of them (11 yr old triplets), they had about 15 questions and they were ALL about my hair. So... This made me decide to make sure I don't shave it before Christmas and it also persuaded me to get a wig. I was just going to wear a halo and hats but I don't think it's normal enough for the kids (I don't normally wear hats.). So,I found a nice one at a local wig shop. I'm sure I ould have found one cheaper online.... But it was nice to try them on and it came with an eventual head shave, wig cut, style and they will "steam" it so it is a little straighter and not so puffy. WaveWhisper..... We had the same tx day. Hope you are doing well. I thought of you on the 19th. :) Happy holidays ladies.... Thank you for all of the support! Josie
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane

Posts.Content: Dec 24, 2011 05:48PM Josie4 wrote: Hi all....quick message for those of you who are struggling with body aches.... I found something that helps! I was in such pain last night and used ICY HOT gel and it have me some relief. Hope it helps anyone else..... Josie
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2011 04:37PM Josie4 wrote: Kimdy and Bailey, good luck tomorrow. you're both one more treatment closer to being done! Rachel, thanks for the advise on the Acidopholus. It's amazing how after just 2 doses of Cipro, I am feeling a lot better. I'm curious to see what my WBC comes back as. The infection came on soooo fast! Within hours, I had developed bronchitis-like symptoms. So happy to be on the mend. Good night, Josie
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2012 03:38PM Josie4 wrote: Yay for those of you who have finished their last chemo! You can REALLY celebrate in two weeks when the side effects are gone! For those of you who have dry skin, I have a great product to recommend. It's called aragon oil. I put it on my face, neck and upper chest. I even put it on my big bald head the other day. My skin jus absorbs it and it then feels so soft and velvety. I got it at QVC. Just go to www.qvc.com and d a search for "Aragon oil.". I love it! I had my last TE fill this week. One side appears to be bigger than the other. The bigger boob is on the Side wherei I had the lymph nodes removed. Maybe the bigger size could be due to swelling? Has anyone else experienced this?I just don't want the final result after the exchange to be uneven sized boobs! I hope everyone has an enjoyable weekend! Josie
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2012 06:04PM Josie4 wrote: Hi ladies... Sorry I've been MIA lately.  It's so exciting to see everyone winding down.  Karmi- I hope you feel better soon!  Maybe as the MO for another round of antibiotics? Erica- um... I'm not liking your MO either.  Weird that he's leaving it up to you!  Baily-  I'm so sorry to hear that it is taking you longer to recover this time.  You are so close to the end!  Hang in there!   AnnieBell- Since you are the veteran of us all.... I'm curious about your HAIR.  :)  Any growth?  Wave- Hope you enjoyed the movie! I'm 8 days post last tx.  I was expecting major cumelitve side effects, but I'm happy to report that they have not been too bad.  I'm tired, but not exhausted.  Bone pain only consists of flashes of pain occasionally.  My only complaint is that I feel queasy every evening.  This is a new side effect for me.  I'm seriously wondering if my nurse didn't give me the full dosage or forgot one of the bags!  Why is this the easiest recovery for me?  Not that I want to feel terrible.... but I hope that something wasn't forgotten! OK..... has anyone gotten a BILL from their MO yet?  I got my first one today.  It says that my insurance paid $11,600 and that I owe $20,230.  THIS IS FOR ONE CHEMO TX!!!!!  I'm sure there is a mistake since I have a cap on my out of pocket max.  I'll still pay $10,000 before my insurance covers the rest.  I need to call my insurance company tomorrow to make sure that this is correct.  My stomach is extra nausous tonight!!!!!  Also, I went to the BS today for a followup. The hard cord that I feel in my armpit and up my arm is thrombosis.  She didn't seem too concerned about it, but I'm going to ask for PT.  I'm maxing out my insurance anyways... I might was well.  Good Night all..... Josie
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2012 02:30PM Josie4 wrote: hi ladies. Again, I've been MIA lately.  I'm trying to find my "new normal."  I don't have cancer and I'm no longer doing chemo, but I sure do still look like it.  Now that chemo is over and the side effects are slowly leaving, I am frustrated with my bald head.  I want hair NOW!  Infact, I've been dreaming about having hair for the past 5 nights! WOW!!  I'm impressed with your doting husbands!  My hubby is great, but he gives me NO special treatment or attentiveness.   I've alwasy be crazy independent and now it has bit me in the butt.  He thinks I can do anything/everything..... including this.  He really is great, but I wish I would have let him know that I needed him more. So, 2 weeks past my last treatment... the only side effect I still have is occasional fatigue and a SUPER dry mouth.  I just can't quench my thirst.  My 4th treatment was the only treatment that I didn't suck on ice during taxotere.  Maybe I should have.  I sleep with my water bottle! I hope you ladies continue to feel better and better! Josie
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane
